TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1636
TEI.2.document_title: A. Dilliar to Stephen F. Austin, 05-04-1827

barker_notes.barker_summary: A. Dilliar to Austin, May 4, 1827. Commerce.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1636

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*A. Dilliar to Austin, May 4, 1827. Commerce.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Harrisburgh */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-04-1827">4th May 1827*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Dr. sir. I have sent you the Articles which you gave me a bill of. 1 Hat 1 piece of *location_mentioned*Irish */location_mentioned*Linen 3 yds. of *location_mentioned*Irish */location_mentioned*sheeting Also 1 Cloak.*/p*
*p*N. B. the bearer of these Articles and letter *person_mentioned*Mr. Fox*/person_mentioned* I have been acquainted with for some time and believe him to be a gentleman in every respect.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*A. Dilliar*/person_mentioned*.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*N. B. I expect to take *location_mentioned*the Land in Bay Prarie*/location_mentioned* agreeable to our last the Barrel of Sugar I have not sent there being no opportunity at present*/p*
*/div1*
